name: Safety First
description: Critical safety checks every homeowner should perform regularly. Protect your family with these essential tests.

templates.name: Smoke Detector Test
templates.description: Monthly test of all smoke detectors to ensure they are functioning properly.
instructions: Alert household members before testing
Press and hold test button on each detector
Verify alarm sounds loudly and clearly
Check that interconnected alarms all sound
Vacuum dust from detector vents
Note any weak-sounding alarms for battery change

templates.name: Smoke Detector Battery Change
templates.description: Annual battery replacement in all smoke detectors, even those with 10-year batteries.
instructions: Remove detector from mounting bracket
Open battery compartment
Remove old battery and dispose properly
Insert fresh 9V battery (check expiration)
Close compartment and remount detector
Press test button to verify operation
Record date of battery change
safetyPrecautions: Change batteries in spring or fall (daylight saving)

templates.name: Fire Extinguisher Inspection
templates.description: Annual inspection of fire extinguisher pressure, accessibility, and condition.
instructions: Check pressure gauge - needle should be in green zone
Verify safety pin and tamper seal are intact
Inspect for visible damage, rust, or dents
Ensure mounting bracket is secure
Confirm easy access (not blocked)
Review operating instructions
Check expiration and service date

templates.name: Dryer Vent Deep Cleaning
templates.description: Thorough cleaning of dryer vent system to prevent house fires. Leading cause of home fires.
instructions: Unplug dryer from electrical outlet
Pull dryer away from wall
Disconnect flexible vent hose
Use dryer vent brush kit to clean entire duct
Go outside and clean exterior vent hood
Vacuum lint from behind and under dryer
Reconnect vent hose with proper clamps
Push dryer back and plug in
Run empty cycle to verify airflow
safetyPrecautions: If gas dryer, check for gas leaks

templates.name: Carbon Monoxide Detector Test
templates.description: Test CO detectors to protect against invisible, odorless carbon monoxide gas.
instructions: Press and hold test button
Listen for alarm sequence
Check display (if digital) for proper operation
Verify detector location is appropriate
Replace batteries if alarm is weak
safetyPrecautions: Install on every level of home
If alarm sounds for real, evacuate immediately
